about_text.value: A minimal-but-expressive storyworld template for 2–3 characters, 3 variables, 10 turns, and 24 encounters with spools + weighted midgame.

text_script.value: Your ship docks at a frontier station on the edge of known space.
A clerk hints your manifest contains a rare item flagged for inspection.
A customs officer eyes your crates with theatrical suspicion.
An old contact offers intel for a price you won’t like.
Rumors swirl about a derelict drifting beyond the trade lanes.
Two crews argue over landing priority with weapons half-drawn.
Raiders descend out of the dark, broadcasting pirate shanties.
An ancient hull spins slowly, its lights winking like old stars.
A merchant smiles too broadly, offering deals that make no sense.
Invisible mines ping faintly against your sensors.
A diplomat suggests a favor-for-favor exchange off the record.
Axel knows a door in the wall. Behind it, everyone’s armed.
The station’s core groans; a spiral of shutdowns cascade.
Workers flood the concourse, chanting for back pay and air filters.
A door that shouldn’t exist opens to a hush of cold light.
Footsteps echo; a familiar silhouette lingers by the outer hatch.
The lights dim to a blue whisper; the station chooses hunger over hope.
You shepherd the desperate into holds and maintenance shafts—breathing room, barely.
Engines hum even; debts tally; the dock endures another season.
A small victory catches; for a moment, justice feels plausible.
Radiance floods the sealed chamber; hands find each other instead of triggers.
Axel vanishes with the ledger; a different kind of order dawns.
The arc tilts. The axis you carry biases your next scene.
The arc tilts. The axis you carry biases your next scene.

meta_description: An interactive storyworld made in SweepWeave.
